apps.linear.postfix
Class StackKeeper

java.lang.Object
  apps.linear.postfix.StackKeeper

 class StackKeeper
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements a stack that is used to evaluate an expression, and stores floating point numbers. It is only visible in its package.

Author:
Sesh Venugopal

          The evaluation stack that keeps operands and results of evaluating sub-expressions.

evalStack

Stack<java.lang.Float> evalStack
The evaluation stack that keeps operands and results of evaluating sub-expressions.

Constructor Detail

StackKeeper

StackKeeper()

Method Detail

init

void init()
Resets the evaluation stack to empty.

update

void update(java.lang.String token)
Updates the evaluation process with a given token. If the token is an operand, it is pushed on the evaluation stack. If it is an operator, an evaluation is done with the operator.

Parameters:
token - Token used for update.

evaluate

private void evaluate(char op)
Helper method for update. Performs an evaluation by applying the binary operator which is accepted as parameter, to the top two operands on the evaluation stack. Pops the top two operands, and pushes the result of the evaluation.

Parameters:
op - Binary operator to be used in evaluation.

isOperator

boolean isOperator(java.lang.String instr)
Tells whether a given token is an operator or not.

Parameters:
instr - Token to be checked.
Returns:
True if token is an operator, false otherwise.

printStack

void printStack(java.io.PrintWriter pw)
Prints the evaluation stack.

Parameters:
pw - PrintWriter used to print the stack.

getTop

float getTop()
Returns the top of stack without removing it.

Returns:
Top of stack.
Throws:
java.util.NoSuchElementException - If the stack is empty.

size

int size()
Gets the number of elements in the stack.

Returns:
Number of elements in stack.
